Helix Tutorial

Learn the fundamentals. Helix is aselection-based editor: you select, then you act.

Key Concept: Selection-First

In Helix, you always select text before performing an action. To delete a word: wd(select word, then delete), not dw.

Command Reference

Movement

Navigate efficiently through your code

h j k lLeft, down, up, right
w b eWord navigation
W B EWORD (space-separated)
f tFind/till character
gg GFirst/last line

Selection

Select text - the core of Helix

xSelect line
v VSelect mode
;Collapse to cursor
%Select entire file

Changes

Edit with minimal keystrokes

i aInsert before/after
dDelete selection
cChange (delete + insert)
y p PYank/paste
rReplace character

Surround

Work with brackets and quotes

mMatch mode
mi( ma(Inside/around parens
ms"Add surround
md"Delete surround

Multi-cursor

Edit multiple locations at once

CCopy to next line
sSplit by regex
,Keep primary selection

Pro Tips

Always know your mode

Watch the mode indicator. Press Escape to return to normal mode.

Think in selections

Before any command, ask: what should I select first?

Use counts

Prefix with numbers: 3w jumps 3 words, 5x selects 5 lines.

Multiple cursors

Use C to create multiple cursors, edit them all at once.

Ready to practice?

Put your knowledge to the test with interactive challenges.
